channel.title: briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesHealthOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Women experience hair loss too. Here's what can help
item.description: Getting a diagnosis is key since there are different causes for the problem calling for different treatments. Here's what to know and how to find supp...

item.title: Obesity drugs, so far only available by injection, may soon be in pill form
item.description: Pill versions of the obesity drugs now taken only as injections are on the way. We look at the science behind the pills and if they might be more affo...

item.title: Researchers say a CDC website change misrepresents vaccine science
item.description: This week a CDC website briefly suggested a vaccine–autism link, prompting experts to urge the public to rely on credible medical guidance.

item.title: After Series of Denials, His Insurer Approved Doctor-Recommended Cancer Care. It Was Too Late.

item.title: Are there lessons for the U.S. in this European country's struggle with measles?
item.description: In 2024, Romania, an upper middle income European country, had over 30,000 cases — putting it on the world's top ten measles list. Its vaccination rat...

item.title: Can vaping help wean people off cigarettes? Anti-smoking advocates are sharply split

item.title: What To Know About the CDC’s Baseless New Guidance on Autism
item.description: A reshaped CDC website suggesting that vaccines cause autism has appalled the medical community.

item.title: Cancer Stole Her Voice. She Used AI, Curse Words, and Kids’ Books To Get It Back.
item.description: After a total glossectomy and laryngectomy to treat her cancer, Sonya Sotinsky can no longer speak. She searched for a way to sound like herself again...

item.title: The Covid Contrarian Clubhouse Makes Its Mark on Trump’s Washington
item.description: Get our weekly newsletter, The Week in Brief, featuring a roundup of our original coverage, Fridays at 2 p.m. ET.

item.title: US Cancer Registries, Constrained by Trump Policies, To Recognize Only ‘Male’ or ‘Female’ Patients
item.description: Under Trump policies, cancer registries in 2026 will have to classify sex data strictly as male, female, or unknown, a change scientists and advocates...
